title: New York Philharmonic Performance History — nyphil
New York Philharmonic Performance History — nyphil
text: tibble 154,988 rows 16 variables: id character string denoting GUID; view program: archives.nyphil.org/index.php/artifact/GUID/fullview program_id character string denoting local NYP ID orchestra character string denoting full orchestra name season character string denoting season; defined Sep 1 - Aug 31, displayed "1842-43" event_type character string denoting name event time; see: http://archives.nyphil.org/index.php/help-performancehistory location character string denoting geographic location concert; countries identified current name. example, even though orchestra played Czechoslovakia, now identified data Czech Republic venue character string denoting name hall, theater, building concert took place date character string denoting full ISO date used, ignore TIME part (1842-12-07T05:00:00Z = Dec. 7, 1842) time character string denoting actual time concert, e.g. "8:00PM" id_2 character string denoting index number used link soloist(s) conductor(s) specific work concerts composer_name character string denoting composer name work_title character string denoting title work; NYP short titles used conductor_name character string denoting conductor name soloist_name character string denoting soloist name (multiple soloists single work, delimited semicolon) soloist_instrument character string denoting soloist instrument name soloist_roles character string denoting soloist role: "S" means "Soloist"; "" means "Assisting Artist" (multiple soloists single work, delimited semicolon)

title: New York Philharmonic Performance History — nyphil

New York Philharmonic Performance History (Raw Data) — nyphil_raw
text: large list containing 'data.frame' 14,407 rows 6 variables: id character string denoting GUID: view program: archives.nyphil.org/index.php/artifact/GUID/fullview programID character string denoting local NYP ID orchestra character string denoting full orchestra name season character string denoting season; defined Sep 1 - Aug 31, displayed "1842-43" concerts list individual performance within program worls list work performed program

title: New York Philharmonic Performance History (Raw Data) — nyphil_raw
